Articles.Content:
We already know that KSP 2 will be built using a newer version of Unity but have we got any information on the new technologies the game might use that weren't in KSP 1? I'm talking things like HDR, ray tracing, DLSS/FSR, VRR, etc. 

The only thing I've noticed myself is that they seem to use HDR Color picker in Unity in this dev diary. Does this mean the game would have some meaningful HDR support?
Rtx is doubtful because last time I saw it, they were working on DX11.
That's actually a bit disappointing if it's still the case as I feel like ray traced shadows and reflections would've looked great in a game like KSP. But why are they still on DX11?
With all the other graphics and physics simulation occurring at the same time hypothetical ray-tracing would be running, I feel that the game would be unplayable in terms of frame rate
